metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4176 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
fs/namespace.c in the Linux kernel before 4.0.2 does not properly support mount connectivity, which allows local users to read arbitrary files by leveraging user-namespace root access for deletion of a file or directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-18-generic - 4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-18-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-18-lowlatency - 4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-18-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-18-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-18-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-18-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-18-generic - 4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-wily package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
